intro: Otacanthus crenatus, commonly known as the wavyleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with wavy edges and vibrant blue or purple trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing vines and flowering plants. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, often found in woodland areas. Otacanthus crenatus is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
